description: Borrowed from New Latin perigynium, from the Ancient Greek περῐ- (peri-) +‎ γῠνή (gunḗ) +‎ -ῐον (-ion). Compare perigynous.

entries.meaning: (botany) Any unusual appendage around the pistil, such as the bottle-shaped body in the sedges, or the bristles and scales in some other genera of the sedge family.
